question: The "1989 Tiananmen Square Protests" happened in which nation?
explanation: The "1989 Tiananmen Square Protests" happened in China. It is also known as the June Fourth Incident. This protests happened in Tiananmen Square of Beijing. The protest's major goals were to end the corruption of the Communist Party of China; to bring democratic reforms such as freedom of the press, freedom of speech, freedom of association and to bring economic-free market reforms in China. But, these protests were brutally suppressed by the Chinese Government which lead to the Tiananmen Square Massacre.
